column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4581_465a13c0bac5470cf4199fcdfe2c2b3eaec476c6/ for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-te

Please first show profiling results that this is actually a problem, before we even look into fixing the 'issue'. I'm not convinced. From what I've seen in my own experiments the network code doesn't even figure into overall CPU usage.\n
The majority of getblocks my node receives from clients is for block invs\nit has already sent to the requesting node. I'll paste logs soon.\n

But anyway, surely this is simply a common sense change in that it's never
been necessary to keep sending block invs already sent to the same node.
Whether there are currently nodes causing this behavior or not should be
irrelevant.
As there is no consensus that this actually an improvement. I don't think this is worth the risk of breaking things.\nClosing this pull.\n

@laanwj I think this is a misleading use of the word "consensus" since there's been no actual discussion regarding this pull requerst.

Please could you re-open it to at least give people a chance to see this, review, test, discuss, etc?
@laanwj you're probably right regarding your CPU comment, wasted bandwidth is more of an issue I suspect.\n
